titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Terri Bamberger Papers, 1951-2001 MS 952
titlestmt.author: Sarah Davidson

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored offsite at the Library Service Center and require 24-hour notice for retrieval. Please contact the Woodson Research Center at 713-348-2586 or woodson@rice.edu for more information.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-03-28 13:28:13 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.abstract: A Pleasantville brochure, a Jewish-Herald Voice Rosh Hashanah magazine, a B'nai B'rith Reflections Book, a photograph of Beth Jacob/Turnberry Circle, and Joske's and Weingarten employee pins document some activities that Terri Bamberger was involved in from 1951 to 2001.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: One box containing a Jewish Herald Voice Rosh Hashanah magazine, a B'nai B'rith reflections book, a Pleasantville brochure, a photo of Beth Jacob/Turnberry Circle, and Joske's and Weingarten employee pins documents some activities that Terri Bamberger was involved in from 1951 to 2001.
This collection forms part of the South Texas Jewish Archives.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored offsite at the Library Service Center and require 24-hour notice for retrieval. Please contact the Woodson Research Center at 713-348-2586 or woodson@rice.edu for more information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated by Terri Bamberger in October 2020.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials in this collection have been arranged into one series: Series I: General.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Terri Bamberger papers, 1951-2001, MS 952, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the Terri Bamberger papers must be obtained from the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library.

The Woodson Research Center use policy is that researchers assume sole responsibility for any infringement of privacy, literary rights, copyrights, or other rights arising from their use of the archival materials. In addition to any restrictions placed by donors, certain kinds of archival materials are restricted for the life of the creator plus 50 years. These materials include, but are not limited to, student grades, transcripts, and any job applications or recommendations.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

did.unittitle: Joske's and Weingarten employee year pins
